Today, the National Counterrorism Center briefed us on how the intelligence community is responding to the global rise of violent white supremacist terror. I will continue to press the FBI to improve its data and address the rising dangers of racial terror.
The FBI must do better. After pressure from our Subcommittee, DHS finally released a framework to address violent white supremacy, with a more detailed action plan to come.

Susan Bro, whose daughter Heather Heyer was murdered by white supremacists in Charlottesville, testified about the failures of the FBI’s data. In her words, “A doctor cannot diagnose a patient without knowing the full set of symptoms.”

At every hearing, every witness – including those invited by my Republican colleagues – agreed that the FBI’s hate crimes data collection is woefully inadequate. We need good data to help us fight the rise of hate-fueled violence.

The FBI had 110 FEWER agencies report in 2018 than in 2017 but the # of hate crimes still rose. The true extent of hate violence is unknown due to systematic underreporting. That’s why I’ve held hearings in the Oversight CRCL Subcmte seeking improvement in the reporting system.

The 2018 hate crimes statistics released by the FBI yesterday reaffirmed that hate crimes are on the rise across America and that advocates of violent white supremacy are targeting racial, ethnic, and religious minorities and the LGBT community. https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/12/politics/hate-crimes-data-fbi-2018/index.html …

We call on President #Erdogan to reverse his course of violent repression and release all the political prisoners, including #Demirtaş, who are standing up for democracy and human rights in #Turkey. #FreeDemirtaş

. . . such as Kurdish politician Selahattin Demirtaş, who has now been in prison for fully three years. I am proud to stand with #Demirtaş and to advocate for his immediate release through the @TLHumanRights #DefendingFreedoms Project. https://raskin.house.gov/media/press-releases/raskin-calls-release-kurdish-political-prisoner-selahattin-demirta-held-turkey …
Under #Erdogan, Turkey has put the #DictatorsPlaybook into action, arresting journalists, targeting academics, threatening judicial independence, and jailing rival political leaders . . .

We cannot overlook Erdogan’s continuing oppressive actions against the Turkish people themselves. He has executed a campaign of repression against anyone who dares disagree with his barbaric policies.

Just weeks ago, the House passed H.J.Res. 77 and H.R. 4695, which denounced Turkey’s military actions against the Kurdish people in northern Syria. https://twitter.com/RepEliotEngel/status/1189301650692984832 …

This time, Erdogan's visit coincides with Turkey’s savage military campaign in northern Syria – an invasion that has killed hundreds of civilians, displaced and driven from their homes over 160,000 people, and produced a massive humanitarian crisis.

During his infamous May 2017 visit to the White House, #Erdogan dispatched his thugs to beat up peaceful protestors, demonstrating before the world his contempt not only for human rights but for the rule of law in America. https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/district-braces-for-planned-visit-by-turkish-president-erdogan/2019/11/08/8943e48c-fb35-11e9-ac8c-8eced29ca6ef_story.html …

When we have overwhelming and uncontradicted evidence of Trump’s Ukraine shakedown, the GOP’s desperate search to out the whistleblower is like arsonists who got caught burning down an office building searching for the person who first called the fire department. It’s irrelevant.

The only function of outing the whistleblower—something Congress has always opposed—is to try to intimidate other potential witnesses. Trump blaming the whistleblower for the Ukraine shakedown is like Nixon blaming Deep Throat for Watergate.  It’s absurd.

The GOP’s obsessive focus on the whistleblower is shameful and embarrassing. The nation is about to hear the truth from a parade of public officials who are direct eyewitnesses to all the critical events and who validate the whistleblower’s claims. https://twitter.com/cspan/status/1194641421556441088 …
